intro: Thlaspi korongianum, commonly known as the Korongianum cabbages, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many species of mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils. Thlaspi korongianum is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to cold, harsh climates.
